channel.title: Internet on Uncle Xiang's Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Internet on Uncle Xiang's Notebook

item.title: Cloudflare experienced a global network outage, causing websites like X (formerly Twitter) and ChatGPT to crash. The stock price suffered a setback ahead of the market open.
item.description:
This siteâ€™s main domain is hosted on GitHub Pages, and the blogâ€™s backup subdomain is on Vercel with acceleration. It has been deployed through Cloudflare. The backend management page looks too outdated and unappealing, which is a major deterrent. Initially, it was a quiet, unassuming piece of content; however, constant messages in the blogging circles disrupted this tranquility â€“ opening it up, CF went down, and many friendsâ€™ websites couldn’t be accessed.

As an internet infrastructure component, such prolonged downtime is unacceptable. The stock price didnâ€™t plummet dramatically, which I hadnâ€™t anticipated.

Cloudflare outage; many well-known websites are inaccessible. Pre-event stock drop, compiling relevant content, outputting articles

November 18, 2025 (Tuesday) â€“ This morning (November 18th), Cloudflare, a major global internet infrastructure services provider, experienced a widespread network outage before the opening of U.S. markets, causing thousands of well-known websites and applications that rely on its services to become paralyzed or difficult to access worldwide.

As a result of this incident, Cloudflareâ€™s (NYSE: NET) stock price fell sharply during pre-market trading.

ğŸŒ Outage Affects Global Services as Popular Platforms â€œGo Downâ€

The outage began on Tuesday morning (approximately 7:00 AM Eastern Time, 11:48 GMT) and was reported globally. Users across the world were unable to access a number of popular services including social media platform X (formerly Twitter), artificial intelligence service OpenAI (ChatGPT), music streaming service Spotify, game platforms League of Legends and Valorant, as well as numerous cryptocurrency exchanges (such as BitMEX, DefiLlama), among others. Users attempting to access these websites generally encountered â€œ500 Internal Server Errorâ€ messages. Given Cloudflareâ€™s role as an â€œintermediaryâ€ in the internet, providing content delivery (CDN) and security protection (DDoS) for millions of websites worldwide, any â€œjitterâ€ within its network immediately triggered a global chain reaction.

ğŸ“‰ Market Reaction Was Rapid, (NET) Pre-Market Stock Drop

As a key infrastructure component for the internet, Cloudflareâ€™s service stability is of significant interest to investors. Following the release of the outage news, the capital markets reacted quickly. Cloudflare’s (NYSE: NET) stock experienced heavy selling in pre-market trading on Tuesday. According to financial data, its price fell approximately 3.5% to 4%, dropping from a previous dayâ€™s close of around $202.25 on November 17th to levels as low as $195.

This reflects investors’ concerns regarding the severity of the service interruption and its potential impact on the companyâ€™s reputation and short-term revenue.

Official Response: Issue Identified and Under Repair

Cloudflareâ€™s official team quickly confirmed this incident on its System Status page. The company updated the status at 13:09 UTC (November 18th) this afternoon (Beijing time) stating:

â€œThe issue has been identified and remediation is being implemented.â€

ğŸ› ï¸ Official Response: Issue Identified and Under Repair

According to Cloudflareâ€™s report, this incident has been classified as a â€œglobal network experiencing issuesâ€ (global network encountering problems) and accompanied by â€œwidespread 500 errors.â€

Cloudflare stated that they are working to mitigate the issue and have observed service beginning to recover, but cautioned that customers may continue to observe â€œabove normal error ratesâ€ during ongoing repair work.

As of this writing, access to some websites has begun to gradually restore, but global network latency and error rates remain high. We will continue to monitor the situationâ€™s further development.

item.title: AI overuse can lead to some lingering effects.
item.description:
Since weâ€™ve established â€œAI Inspiration Collision Forum,â€ thereâ€™s been a lot of random content being created, with people experimenting with AI to record and publish things, but thoughtful reflection is becoming increasingly scarce. Moving forward, it would be beneficial to slightly control the output of this section and consolidate it into a monthly magazine format â€“ releasing one article per month would suffice.

This feels like a sort of aftereffect or side effect; efficiency has increased, but the depth and breadth of thought have declined.

Efficiency Boost: Undeniable

The â€œSeven-Second Fish Sightseeingâ€ column used to be poorly maintained, with only a few hot events covered. Due to laziness, I hadnâ€™t searched the internet for relevant materials or compiled records. Now that various AI tools are available, all it takes is outlining the key points, and AI can automatically search for related events, generate articles as needed, simply format them, and publish them.

It’s like a blessing for lazy people â€“ efficiency has increased significantly, almost to the point of doubling efforts.

Beyond writing articles, efficiency gains are real when coding. Previously, writing code often required detailed reading of API interface documentation. Now, I can skip this entirely. This is incredibly valuable because familiarizing oneself with APIs is â€œphysical labor,â€ not â€œmental labor.â€ AI handles this part perfectly.

Spam Content

Many articles have poor quality content, not to say that thereâ€™s nothing there; it just doesn’t read well, lacking a sense of reality and what people actually experience. Itâ€™s a style I didnâ€™t enjoy before â€“ like chewing wax.

From another perspective, AI-generated content really does feel like products of aæµæ°´çº¿ (liÃº shuÇ liÃ n - assembly line) production, lacking soul.

New Era Internet Spam

Forgetting

This type of document is entirely AI-generated, and the readerâ€™s context is unclear. However, over time, my own impressions will become blurred, or even forgotten.

Similar issues occur when writing code â€“ without reviewing commit records, I can’t remember how I originally thought about it, or why I wrote it that way. This is particularly evident with code generated through repeated communication with AI, where the final code differs significantly from the initial ideas, sometimes drastically so.

Search

Recently, the number of times Iâ€™ve opened Google and Baidu has noticeably decreased. Many questions are now being answered by AI for searching and interaction, and the results are much better than traditional search engines.

Let’s mourn the bing ai, which may no longer be active, a pioneering AI tool from a major company that could connect to the internet and search.

Iâ€™m using Google less, and the number of times I visit stackoverflow has decreased as well. Many questions are now simply asked of AI â€“ this website is gradually being phased out by the times.

Conclusion

My maintained blog, originally with very little traffic, is now even less expected of; itâ€™s primarily a place for self-reflection and recording.
